properties.description: Posted by Chill888Col de la Croix de FerGreat 35km climb past two huge alpine lakes created by damns. Often featured in the Tour de France. Last climbed by me May 2005

properties.description: Posted by Chill888I watched the 2004 Tour de France on this climb. Short but STEEP. Great views of Lake Annecy.

properties.name: Lauterbrunnen Valley
properties.description: Posted by Chill888One of the most beautiful valleys in the world. The narrow cliff sides of this swiss paradise are covered with dozens of waterfalls. There is also a huge waterfall inside the mountain that can be visited (Trummelbach - see link). Its worth looking at this location using Google Earth to see the shape of the valley and the amazing mountains surrounding.

properties.name: Manneken-Pis Bar
properties.description: Posted by Chill888Avoid the snobby tourist trap Harry\'s New York Bar across the street. Where we were informed that drinks were expensive (implying too expensive for rifraff like us). Mannekin Pis was friendly and cozy with a great Senegalese bar-tenderess that now features in some of our vacation photos.

properties.name: Mont Revard
properties.description: Posted by Chill88820kms 1210 metres climb

properties.name: Mont Ventoux - Volcano in provence
properties.description: Posted by Chill888Cool map! OK slightly off topic (hope u don\'t mind) but here is the only volcano I ever cycled up. Does that count? Ventoux (means windy) is an extinct volcano in Provence, France. The highest wind speeds in France have been recorded there. It is STEEP but amazing climb up to a barren, moon-like atmosphere. Lance Armstrong and the Tour de France have had many epic struggles here. How hard is it? Tom Simpon collapsed and died near the top in the late 60\'s during the race (photo is of his memorial on side of road where he died).

properties.name: Val d'Isere
properties.description: Posted by Chill888Val d\'IsereMy favourite and world famous. Good snow well into May. The cycling photo is from mid June and still lots of snow. Ski resort goes to 3,300 metres (about 11,000 feet) Also a classic cycling climb in summer.

properties.name: Zermatt (Matterhorn)
properties.description: Posted by Chill888Another great ski resort... with the Matterhorn in the background. Zermatt is a picture postcard swiss Car-free village. Summer skiing high in the glacier. Also great cycling in summer
